content.description:
Sit start on the right side of the south face and move up using the arete and face holds. The sit start is the crux and if you stand start there is a noticeable difference with hand placements and movement.

NOTE: I do apologize for not getting pictures of either the face of the boulder OR someone climbing it for reference. I will get those ASAP and post.
content.location: Reference pictures for more information. There is a down climb on the southeast corner (just around the corner from the problem).

content.description: Stand start with a right on the arete and a left hand on a terrible sloper with a positive right foot. Move up using primarily the arete and a positive jug at the top.
content.location: Reference picture for exact details. There is a down climb on the southeast corner of the problem.

content.description: Sit start in the center of the south face, move upward, and top out.
content.location: This starts in the center of the south face. Reference pictures for more information. There is a down climb on the southeast corner.

content.description: Stand start on the left side of the south face with a positive left side pull on the arete and terribly small feet. Move up the arete and top out with a little hop near the end as a result of having terrible feet.
content.location: Stand start on the left side of the south face. There is a down climb on the southeast corner of the boulder. Reference pictures for more details.
